metadata.title: CVE-2017-14120 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
unrar 0.0.1 (aka unrar-free or unrar-gpl) suffers from a directorytraversal vulnerability for RAR v2 archives: pathnames of the form../[filename] are unpacked into the upper directory.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14120` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

unrar-free - 1:0.0.1+cvs20071127-2+deb7u1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: unrar-free package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:0.0.1+cvs20071127-2+deb7u1').
